definitions: lacking grace or skill in physical movement or coordination
causing or feeling embarrassment and discomfort in social situations
inconvenient or difficult to use, handle, or manage effectively
examples: His awkward movements made dancing quite challenging
The heavy box was awkward to carry upstairs
There was an awkward silence after her comment
Meeting your ex at parties can be awkward
The furniture's awkward placement blocked the doorway completely
This tool has an awkward design for left-handed users

definitions: relating to or located in the residential areas on the outskirts of cities
having qualities typical of suburban life, culture, or middle-class residential communities
examples: They moved to a suburban neighborhood for better schools
The suburban train connects downtown with residential areas
Her suburban lifestyle included weekend barbecues and lawn care
The movie portrayed typical suburban values and aspirations

definitions: relaxed and unconcerned in manner, style, or dress without formality
happening by chance or without regularity in an informal way
showing or feeling little interest, concern, or commitment to something
examples: She wore casual clothes to the weekend gathering
The restaurant has a casual atmosphere perfect for families
They maintain a casual friendship with occasional meetups
He does casual work whenever extra income is needed
His casual attitude toward deadlines frustrated his colleagues
She made a casual remark about leaving her job

definitions: quick to understand, learn, and devise or apply ideas with intelligence
showing ingenuity, originality, or skill in design, construction, or execution
examples: The clever student solved the puzzle before anyone else
She always has clever responses to difficult questions
The architect created a clever solution for limited space
That's a clever gadget for opening stubborn jar lids

definitions: involving or causing a complete or dramatic change in existing methods or ideas
relating to or supporting political revolution that overthrows established government systems
examples: The smartphone was a revolutionary device that changed communication
Her revolutionary approach to teaching transformed the classroom experience
The revolutionary forces fought against the oppressive regime
He studied revolutionary movements throughout Latin American history

definitions: occupying or using the complete number of hours considered normal for working
requiring or involving total commitment of time and effort to activity
examples: She accepted a full-time position at the marketing firm
The company offers benefits to all full-time employees
Being a parent is a full-time responsibility
Managing this project has become a full-time job

definitions: concerning the profession, activity, or skill of managing international relations between countries
having or showing skill in dealing with others without causing offense
examples: The diplomatic mission negotiated a peaceful resolution
She pursued a diplomatic career in foreign service
His diplomatic response avoided escalating the office conflict
A diplomatic approach works better than direct confrontation

definitions: happening or existing without stopping or being interrupted over time
extending or carrying on further in time, space, or development
examples: The continuing drought has affected crop yields significantly
There's a continuing need for affordable housing solutions
Her continuing education includes evening business classes
The continuing story will be revealed in next season

definitions: relating to elections or the process of electing representatives through voting
examples: The electoral system determines how votes translate into seats
Campaign finance reform addresses electoral integrity concerns
Electoral districts are redrawn every ten years following census
The party's electoral strategy focused on swing states

definitions: suffering from physical injury, damage, or pain to the body
experiencing emotional pain, distress, or psychological damage from words or actions
examples: The hurt athlete couldn't continue playing the game
My hurt ankle needs ice and rest to heal
She felt hurt by his thoughtless comments about her
The hurt expression on his face showed deep disappointment

definitions: having a dull yellowish-green color like that of unripe olives
relating to or made from the oval fruit of olive trees
examples: She wore an olive jacket that matched her eyes
The walls were painted in a subtle olive shade
The olive oil comes from first cold pressing
They served olive tapenade with fresh bread

definitions: existing in thought or as an idea but not having physical existence
relating to art that uses shapes and colors rather than realistic representation
examples: Love is an abstract concept difficult to define precisely
The philosopher dealt with abstract questions about existence
The gallery featured abstract paintings with bold geometric forms
Her abstract sculptures challenged traditional artistic boundaries

definitions: happening or occurring in the near future or next period
about to arrive or appear at a place or position
examples: The coming winter is expected to be harsh
She's preparing for the coming exam next week
The coming train will arrive at platform three
Watch for coming traffic before crossing the street

definitions: made better in quality, condition, or performance than before
enhanced or developed to achieve a higher standard or greater effectiveness
examples: The improved recipe uses less sugar but tastes better
His improved grades earned him a scholarship
The improved highway reduces travel time by thirty minutes
She showed improved confidence after months of practice

definitions: featuring new methods, ideas, or products that break from traditional approaches
showing creativity and original thinking in developing solutions or concepts
examples: The company's innovative technology revolutionized smartphone batteries
Their innovative teaching methods engage students more effectively
She's known for innovative designs that challenge fashion norms
The chef's innovative menu combines unexpected flavor profiles

definitions: relating to the structure and characteristics of human populations and their segments
examples: Demographic data shows an aging population in rural areas
The marketing team analyzed demographic trends for product development
Different demographic groups have varying healthcare needs and preferences
The survey collected demographic information including age and income

definitions: not based on or behaving according to principles of justice or equality
not following or respecting established rules, standards, or reasonable expectations
examples: The unfair distribution of resources created social tensions
It's unfair to blame him for circumstances beyond control
The referee called an unfair advantage during the match
Using inside information gives traders an unfair edge

definitions: causing or characterized by extreme distress, sorrow, or unfortunate consequences
relating to drama dealing with tragic events and unhappy endings
examples: The tragic accident claimed three young lives yesterday
It's tragic when natural disasters destroy entire communities
Shakespeare wrote many tragic plays about doomed heroes
The tragic ending left the audience in tears

definitions: moving or capable of moving at greater speed than something else
happening, done, or accomplished in less time than something else
examples: The new processor is faster than previous generations
Cheetahs are faster runners than any other land animal
This route is faster during morning rush hour
Digital payments are faster than writing checks

definitions: extremely beautiful, attractive, or magnificent in appearance to the eyes
very pleasant, enjoyable, or excellent in quality or character
examples: The bride looked gorgeous in her wedding dress
The sunset created gorgeous colors across the sky
We had gorgeous weather for the outdoor concert
The hotel room had a gorgeous view of mountains

definitions: designed for people to live in rather than for business or industry
relating to or providing accommodation where people reside for extended periods
examples: The residential area has parks and quiet tree-lined streets
New residential buildings must meet updated safety codes
The residential treatment facility helps teens with addiction issues
Students live in residential halls during their first year

definitions: going past or moving by something or someone in space
lasting for only a short time or not permanent in nature
achieving the minimum acceptable standard or grade in a test
examples: The passing cars created noise throughout the night
She waved at passing strangers during her morning walk
He felt only passing interest in the subject
The passing years had mellowed his harsh opinions
She received a passing grade on the difficult exam
The work meets passing standards but needs improvement

definitions: designed or intended for use in teaching, education, or providing instruction
examples: The instructional video demonstrated proper safety procedures clearly
Teachers need access to quality instructional materials
The museum offers instructional programs for school groups
She writes instructional guides for complex software applications

definitions: not supporting or helping either side in a conflict or disagreement
having no electrical charge or being chemically neither acid nor alkaline
having no strongly marked characteristics, features, or emotional qualities
examples: Switzerland remained neutral during both world wars
The mediator must stay neutral between disputing parties
The solution has a neutral pH of seven
Neutral atoms have equal protons and electrons
She chose neutral colors for the office decor
His neutral expression revealed nothing about his thoughts

definitions: brought together or merged to form a single unit or substance
involving the joint action or effort of two or more entities
examples: The combined ingredients created a delicious new flavor
Their combined savings finally afforded the house downpayment
The combined forces of both armies overwhelmed the enemy
A combined effort from all departments solved the problem

definitions: dearly loved, cherished, or held in deep affection by someone
describing a person who is greatly loved or dear to someone
examples: Her beloved grandmother passed away last spring peacefully
The beloved family pet brought joy for many years
He wrote poems to his beloved throughout their courtship
The nation mourned their beloved leader's sudden death

definitions: belonging to a foreign country or nation and seeming strange
relating to or denoting beings from other worlds or outer space
examples: The alien customs confused newly arrived immigrants
This concept feels alien to our way of thinking
Science fiction movies often feature alien invasions from space
The mysterious signals might indicate alien intelligence

definitions: needed or necessary for a particular purpose or situation to work
officially compulsory or demanded by rules, laws, or regulations
examples: The recipe lists all required ingredients for the cake
Experience is required for this senior management position
Students must complete all required courses before graduating
The required documentation includes birth certificate and passport

definitions: showing or characterized by prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism against racial groups
supporting or based on the belief that races have distinct characteristics determining superiority
examples: His racist comments offended everyone at the meeting
The company fired employees for racist behavior
The racist policies excluded minorities from voting rights
Historical racist laws created lasting social inequalities

definitions: experiencing worry, unease, or nervousness about something with uncertain outcome
wanting something very much and eager or impatient for it
examples: She felt anxious about the upcoming job interview
The anxious parents waited for news from the hospital
The children were anxious to open their birthday presents
He's anxious to start his new position next month

definitions: not sleeping and conscious of one's surroundings at the moment
fully conscious, alert, and aware of something important or significant
examples: The baby kept us awake all night with crying
She lay awake thinking about tomorrow's presentation
Citizens must stay awake to threats against democracy
The documentary kept viewers awake to environmental issues

definitions: having a flat, smooth surface without slopes, bumps, or indentations
having the same height, position, or value as something else
examples: The carpenter ensured the floor was perfectly level
You need level ground to pitch a tent properly
Their scores remained level throughout the competition
Keep the picture frame level with the window sill

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a tribe or tribes and their organization
showing strong loyalty to one's social group over broader society
examples: Tribal customs have been preserved for many generations
The museum displays beautiful tribal art from Africa
Political discourse has become increasingly tribal and polarized
Their tribal mentality prevents cooperation with other departments

definitions: designed or serving to protect someone or something from harm or damage
having or showing a strong wish to keep someone safe from harm
examples: Workers must wear protective equipment in the factory
The protective coating prevents rust on metal surfaces
She's very protective of her younger siblings
His protective instincts emerged when danger approached

definitions: of the least possible amount, extent, or degree in size or importance
barely adequate or the least that is needed for a purpose
examples: The storm caused minimal damage to the building
She prefers minimal makeup for a natural look
He did minimal work to pass the course
The instructions require minimal technical knowledge

definitions: providing help, assistance, or structural support to maintain or strengthen something
showing encouragement, emotional help, and understanding to someone
examples: The supportive beams hold up the entire roof structure
Comfortable shoes provide supportive cushioning for your feet
Her supportive friends helped during the difficult divorce
A supportive work environment improves employee satisfaction

definitions: being the only one of its kind or the single one present
belonging or restricted to one person or group exclusively
examples: She was the sole survivor of the plane crash
His sole focus is completing the marathon
The company has sole distribution rights in this region
As sole heir, she inherited the entire estate

definitions: relating to money, currency, or the systems that countries use to manage money
examples: The central bank adjusts monetary policy to control inflation
They reached a monetary settlement outside of court
Monetary rewards motivate some employees more than recognition
The country faced a monetary crisis during the recession

definitions: nervous or timid in the company of others, especially in social situations
having less than a full or expected amount of something
examples: The shy child hid behind her mother's legs
He's too shy to speak up during meetings
We're still shy three volunteers for the event
The total came up fifty dollars shy

definitions: having great influence on someone or something through power, authority, or persuasion
examples: She became an influential voice in environmental policy
The influential newspaper shaped public opinion significantly
His influential connections helped launch her career
The study was influential in changing medical practices

definitions: relating to or consisting of words in general language use
communicated in spoken words rather than in writing or actions
examples: Her verbal skills impressed the interview panel greatly
Children develop verbal abilities at different rates
They made a verbal agreement to share profits
The doctor gave verbal instructions for wound care

definitions: having or marked by bad fortune, unlucky circumstances, or adverse outcomes
unsuitable, inappropriate, or regrettable in the circumstances
examples: The unfortunate family lost their home in the fire
An unfortunate accident delayed the wedding ceremony
His unfortunate choice of words offended many listeners
It's unfortunate that we can't attend your celebration

definitions: becoming apparent, known, or prominent after being hidden or unknown
in the process of coming into being or becoming established
examples: New evidence is emerging about the ancient civilization
The emerging pattern suggests a different conclusion
India is an emerging economy with rapid growth
Emerging technologies will transform how we work

definitions: deserving effort, attention, or respect due to good qualities or importance
having sufficient worth, merit, or value for a specified thing
examples: She proved herself a worthy successor to the founder
The charity supports many worthy causes in education
This proposal isn't worthy of serious consideration
His performance was worthy of the gold medal

definitions: extra or additional to what already exists or has been counted
recently included, joined, or combined with something that existed before
examples: The added sugar makes this cereal less healthy
There's an added charge for express delivery
The added features make this model more expensive
With added experience, she became more confident

definitions: easily broken, damaged, or destroyed due to fragile construction
requiring careful, sensitive, or tactful treatment to avoid problems
characterized by subtle and refined beauty, intricacy, or precision
examples: The delicate glass ornament shattered when it fell
Handle these delicate electronics with extreme care
It's a delicate situation requiring diplomatic skills
The surgery involves delicate work near vital organs
She has delicate features and porcelain skin
The wine has a delicate flavor with floral notes

definitions: showing or feeling opposition, resistance, or unfriendliness toward someone
creating harsh, difficult, or unwelcoming conditions for life or activity
examples: The hostile crowd shouted at the unpopular speaker
She received a hostile reception at the meeting
The hostile environment of the desert challenges survival
Hostile weather conditions forced the expedition to retreat

definitions: having no ability or skill to serve a purpose or function
not achieving or unlikely to achieve the intended purpose or desired outcome
examples: This broken tool is completely useless now
The map was useless without street names
His advice proved useless in solving the problem
It's useless to argue with someone so stubborn

definitions: having or showing cautious distrust of someone or something
causing one to have the idea that something is wrong or questionable
examples: She was suspicious of his sudden generosity
The detective remained suspicious despite the alibi
The suspicious package prompted an evacuation
His suspicious behavior attracted police attention

definitions: moving forward by turning over and over on an axis
having gentle rises and falls in landscape like waves
examples: The rolling ball gathered speed down the hill
Keep rolling the dough until it's thin enough
The rolling hills stretched for miles across countryside
She loved the rolling landscape of rural England
